## Return Value

The initialized navigation controller object or `nil` if there was a problem initializing the object.

To customize the overall appearance of a navigation bar, use [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIAppearance] APIs instead of this method. If you use this initialization method to create a navigation bar that uses custom bar subclasses, you are responsible for pushing and setting view controllers before presenting the navigation controller onscreen.

# init(navigationBarClass:toolbarClass:)

**Initializer**

Initializes and returns a newly created navigation controller that uses your custom bar subclasses.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor init(navigationBarClass: AnyClass?, toolbarClass: AnyClass?)
```

## Parameters

- **navigationBarClass**: Specify the custom [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UINavigationBar] subclass you want to use, or specify `nil` to use the standard [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UINavigationBar] class.
- **toolbarClass**: Specify the custom [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIToolbar] subclass you want to use, or specify `nil` to use the standard [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIToolbar] class.

## Return Value

The initialized navigation controller object or `nil` if there was a problem initializing the object.

## Discussion

To customize the overall appearance of a navigation bar, use [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIAppearance] APIs instead of this method. If you use this initialization method to create a navigation bar that uses custom bar subclasses, you are responsible for pushing and setting view controllers before presenting the navigation controller onscreen.

## Creating a navigation controller

- **init(rootViewController:)**: Initializes and returns a newly created navigation controller.
- **init(nibName:bundle:)**: Creates a navigation controller with the nib file in the specified bundle.
- **init(coder:)**: Creates a navigation controller from data in an unarchiver.
